verses.kjv: And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve were with him,
verses.web: Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve,
verses.ct: After this, Jesus traveled through cities and villages, preaching and announcing the good news of the kingdom of God. The 12 disciples were with him,

verses.kjv: And certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,
verses.web: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.ct: along with certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and diseases. Among them was Mary, called Magdalene, from whom 7 demons had been driven out;

verses.kjv: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.
verses.web: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.
verses.ct: Joanna, the wife of Chuza, who was Herod's household manager; Susanna; and many others. These women supported Jesus and his disciples out of their own resources.

verses.kjv: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:
verses.web: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.
verses.ct: A huge crowd was gathering, with people streaming in from every town. Jesus told them a parable:

verses.kjv: A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.
verses.web: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.
verses.ct: "A farmer went out to plant his seed. As he scattered it, some fell along the path, where it was trampled underfoot, and the birds came and ate it up.

verses.kjv: And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.
verses.web: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.ct: Some fell on rocky ground, and as soon as it sprouted, it withered because it had no moisture.

verses.kjv: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.
verses.web: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.
verses.ct: Some fell among thorn bushes, and the thorns grew up alongside it and choked it out.

verses.kjv: And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold. And when he had said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.web: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and produced one hundred times as much fruit.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.ct: But some fell on good soil, and it grew and produced a crop 100 times what was planted." After saying this, he called out, "If you have ears to hear, then listen!"

verses.kjv: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?
verses.web: Then his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”
verses.ct: His disciples asked him, "What does this parable mean?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.
verses.web: He said, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of God’s Kingdom, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.ct: He said, "You have been given the ability to understand the mysteries of the kingdom of God. But for others, these truths come in parables, so that 'seeing, they may not truly see, and hearing, they may not understand.'"

verses.kjv: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.web: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.ct: "Here's what the parable means: The seed is the word of God.

verses.kjv: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
verses.web: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.ct: The seed along the path represents people who hear the word, but then the devil comes and snatches it from their hearts so they won't believe and be saved.

verses.kjv: They on the rock are they, which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
verses.web: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.
verses.ct: The seed on rocky ground represents people who hear the word and receive it with joy, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but when temptation comes, they fall away.

verses.kjv: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
verses.web: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.
verses.ct: The seed that fell among thorns represents people who hear the word, but as they go through life, they get choked by worries, wealth, and pleasures, and they never produce mature fruit.

verses.kjv: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.
verses.web: Those in the good ground, these are those who with an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and produce fruit with perseverance.
verses.ct: But the seed on good soil represents people with an honest and good heart who hear the word, hold on to it, and produce fruit through patience."

verses.kjv: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but setteth it on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.
verses.web: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.
verses.ct: "No one lights a lamp and then covers it with a bowl or shoves it under a bed. Instead, they put it on a stand so that everyone who comes in can see the light.

verses.kjv: For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither any thing hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.
verses.web: For nothing is hidden that will not be revealed; nor anything secret that will not be known and come to light.
verses.ct: Nothing is secret that won't eventually be revealed, and nothing is hidden that won't be made known and brought into the open.

verses.kjv: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.
verses.web: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”
verses.ct: So pay close attention to how you listen. Whoever has understanding will be given more, but whoever doesn't have it — even what they think they have will be taken away."

verses.kjv: Then came to him his mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.
verses.web: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.
verses.ct: Jesus' mother and brothers came to see him, but they couldn't get to him because of the crowd.

verses.kjv: And it was told him by certain which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.
verses.web: Some people told him, “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”
verses.ct: Someone told him, "Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you."

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
verses.web: But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”
verses.ct: He replied, "My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and put it into practice."

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.
verses.web: Now on one of those days, he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.
verses.ct: One day Jesus got into a boat with his disciples and said, "Let's cross over to the other side of the lake." So they set out.

verses.kjv: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.
verses.web: But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.
verses.ct: As they sailed, Jesus fell asleep. Then a fierce windstorm swept down on the lake, and the boat was filling with water. They were in serious danger.

verses.kjv: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.
verses.web: They came to him, and awoke him, saying, “Master, master, we are dying!” He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.
verses.ct: The disciples rushed to him and woke him up, shouting, "Master, Master, we're going to drown!" He got up and commanded the wind and the raging waves to stop. They obeyed, and everything became perfectly calm.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.
verses.web: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” Being afraid they marveled, saying to one another, “Who is this then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”
verses.ct: He turned to them and asked, "Where is your faith?" Shaken and amazed, they said to each other, "Who is this man? He gives orders to the wind and the water, and they obey him!"

verses.kjv: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.
verses.web: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.ct: They sailed to the region of the Gadarenes, which is across the lake from Galilee.

verses.kjv: And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in any house, but in the tombs.
verses.web: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs.
verses.ct: When Jesus stepped ashore, a man from the town met him who had been possessed by demons for a long time. He wore no clothes and didn't live in a house — he lived among the tombs.

verses.kjv: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.
verses.web: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”
verses.ct: When he saw Jesus, he screamed and threw himself down before him, shouting, "What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I'm begging you, don't torment me!"

verses.kjv: (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)
verses.web: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bonds apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
verses.ct: He said this because Jesus had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of him. The spirit had seized him many times before. Even when he was chained hand and foot under guard, he would snap the chains and be driven by the demon into desolate places.

verses.kjv: And Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name? And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.
verses.web: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered into him.
verses.ct: Jesus asked him, "What is your name?" He answered, "Legion" — because many demons had entered him.

verses.kjv: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.
verses.web: They begged him that he would not command them to go into the abyss.
verses.ct: The demons kept begging Jesus not to send them into the abyss.

verses.kjv: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.
verses.web: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. Then he allowed them.
verses.ct: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the mountainside nearby. The demons begged Jesus to let them enter the pigs, and he gave them permission.

verses.kjv: Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.
verses.web: The demons came out of the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake, and were drowned.
verses.ct: The demons came out of the man and went into the pigs. The entire herd stampeded down the steep bank into the lake and drowned.

verses.kjv: When they that fed them saw what was done, they fled, and went and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.web: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.ct: When the men tending the pigs saw what happened, they ran off and reported it throughout the town and the surrounding countryside.

verses.kjv: Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
verses.web: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
verses.ct: People came out to see what had happened. When they reached Jesus, they found the man the demons had left — sitting at Jesus' feet, dressed, and completely sane. This terrified them.

verses.kjv: They also which saw it told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.
verses.web: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.
verses.ct: The eyewitnesses told everyone how the demon-possessed man had been healed.

verses.kjv: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.
verses.web: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. Then he entered into the boat and returned.
verses.ct: Then the entire population of the Gadarene region begged Jesus to leave, because they were overwhelmed with fear. So he got into the boat and headed back.

verses.kjv: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.web: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.ct: The man who had been freed from the demons begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

verses.kjv: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee. And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.
verses.web: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.” He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.ct: "Go home and tell everyone what God has done for you." So the man went through the whole city, declaring what Jesus had done for him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people gladly received him: for they were all waiting for him.
verses.web: When Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.
verses.ct: When Jesus returned to the other side, the crowd welcomed him eagerly because they had all been waiting for him.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus’ feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:
verses.web: Behold, a man named Jairus came. He was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged him to come into his house,
verses.ct: Just then, a man named Jairus came forward. He was a synagogue leader. He fell at Jesus' feet and pleaded with him to come to his house,

verses.kjv: For he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.
verses.web: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.
verses.ct: because his only daughter, about 12 years old, was dying. As Jesus made his way there, the crowds pressed in around him from every side.

verses.kjv: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,
verses.web: A woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians and could not be healed by any
verses.ct: In the crowd was a woman who had been suffering from bleeding for 12 years. She had spent everything she had on doctors, but no one could heal her.

verses.kjv: Came behind him, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.
verses.web: came behind him, and touched the fringe of his cloak. Immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
verses.ct: She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his garment. Instantly, her bleeding stopped.

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Who touched me? When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?
verses.web: Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.ct: Jesus asked, "Who touched me?" Everyone denied it, and Peter said, "Master, the whole crowd is pushing and pressing against you. How can you ask, 'Who touched me?'"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.
verses.web: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "Someone deliberately touched me. I felt power go out from me."

verses.kjv: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.web: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.ct: When the woman realized she couldn't hide, she came forward trembling and fell at his feet. In front of everyone, she explained why she had touched him and how she had been healed instantly.

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.
verses.web: He said to her, “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to her, "Daughter, take heart. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace."

verses.kjv: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.
verses.web: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.”
verses.ct: While Jesus was still speaking, someone arrived from Jairus' house with a message: "Your daughter is dead. Don't bother the Teacher anymore."

verses.kjv: But when Jesus heard it, he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.
verses.web: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”
verses.ct: But when Jesus heard this, he told Jairus, "Don't be afraid. Just believe, and she will be healed."

verses.kjv: And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.
verses.web: When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.
verses.ct: When he arrived at the house, he didn't let anyone go inside with him except Peter, James, John, and the girl's father and mother.

verses.kjv: And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.web: All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.”
verses.ct: Everyone there was weeping and mourning for her. Jesus said, "Stop crying. She isn't dead — she's sleeping."

verses.kjv: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.
verses.web: They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.ct: They laughed at him, because they knew she was dead.

verses.kjv: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise.
verses.web: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying, “Child, arise!”
verses.ct: But Jesus sent them all outside. He took the girl by the hand and called out, "Child, get up!"

verses.kjv: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.
verses.web: Her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. He commanded that something be given to her to eat.
verses.ct: Her spirit returned, and she stood up immediately. Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat.

verses.kjv: And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.
verses.web: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them to tell no one what had been done.
verses.ct: Her parents were astonished, but Jesus strictly instructed them not to tell anyone what had happened.
